intro: Pedicularis crassirostris, commonly known as the broad-beaked lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic nature and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces striking red or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its unique structure includes a long, slender corolla that resembles a beak, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas.
